intro: Phaseoloides pachycarpum, commonly known as the thick-fruited bean, is a climbing legume native to Central and South America. It produces large, fleshy pods that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length, containing several seeds. The plant has compound leaves with trifoliate or pinnate structures, and its flowers are typically white or pale purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The species is valued for its edible seeds, which are used in traditional cuisines.
